conclusion: To solve the problem, calculate the work done by the frictional force on the object as it moves from point M to point N on the conveyor belt.

The image shows a conveyor belt moving clockwise at a speed of v = 6 m/s. The belt has two drive wheels labeled M and N, with a distance of L1 = 10 m between them. An object with mass m = 3 kg is placed on the belt directly above wheel M. The coefficient of kinetic friction between the object and the belt is μ = 0.3.
The object's mass is m = 3 kg, and the coefficient of kinetic friction is μ = 0.3.
The force of friction Ff is given by Ff = μ × m × g = 0.3 × 3 kg × 10 m/s² = 9 N.
The object moves a horizontal distance of L1 = 10 m from point M to point N.
The work done by the frictional force is calculated as W = Ff × L1 = 9 N × 10 m = 90 J.
